get.description: List people and integrations associated with a given team.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for team

GET.description: Returns customer's user by user GUID.

get.description: List users of your PagerDuty account, optionally filtered by a search query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only the escalation policies whose names contain the query.

post.description: Create a new user. Note that you must also supply a `password` property to create a user--it will not be returned by any API.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user to be created.

get.description: REST API Reference.
List all of your account's abilities, by name.
Test whether your account has a given ability.
List all of the add-ons installed on your account.

parameters.name: service_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only add-ons for the given services

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only add-ons of the given type

post.description: Install an add-on for your account.

parameters.name: addon
parameters.description: The add-on to be installed.

get.description: Get details about an existing add-on.

parameters.name: addon
parameters.description: The add-on to be installed.

get.description: List all of the existing escalation policies.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only the escalation policies whose names contain the query.

parameters.name: user_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only escalation policies on which any of the users is a target.

post.description: Creates a new escalation policy. There must be at least one existing escalation rule added to create a new escalation policy.

parameters.name: escalation_policy
parameters.description: The escalation policy to be created.

get.description: Get information about an existing escalation policy and its rules.

delete.description: Deletes an existing escalation policy and rules. The escalation policy must not be in use by any services.

put.description: Updates an existing escalation policy and rules.

parameters.name: escalation_policy
parameters.description: The escalation policy to be created.

get.description: List existing incidents.

parameters.name: statuses[]
parameters.description: Return only incidents with the given statuses. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (incident_number/created_on/resolved_on/urgency), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending. The account must have the `urgencies` ability to sort by the urgency.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

put.description: Acknowledge, resolve, escalate or reassign one or more incidents.

get.description: Show detailed information about an incident. Accepts either an incident id, or an incident number.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Either the id or number of the incident to retrieve.

put.description: Acknowledge, resolve, escalate or reassign an incident.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Either the id or number of the incident to retrieve.

get.summary: List log entries for the incident
get.description: List log entries for the specified incident.

get.summary: List existing notes for the specified incident
get.description: List existing notes for the specified incident.

post.summary: Create a new note for the specified incident
post.description: Create a new note for the specified incident.

get.description: List all of the incident log entries across the entire account.
Get details for a specific incident log entry. This method provides additional information you can use to get at raw event data.
List existing maintenance windows, optionally filtered by service and/or team, or whether they are from the past, present or future.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only add-ons of the given type

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only the escalation policies whose names contain the query.

post.description: Create a new maintenance window for the specified services. No new incidents will be created for a service that is in maintenance.

parameters.name: maintenance_window
parameters.description: The maintenance window object.

get.description: Get an existing maintenance window.

delete.summary: Delete or end a maintenance window
delete.description: Delete an existing maintenance window if it's in the future, or end it if it's currently on-going. If the maintenance window has already ended it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: maintenance_window
parameters.description: The maintenance window object.

get.description: List notifications for a given time range, optionally filtered by type (sms_notification, email_notification, phone_notification, or push_notification).

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only add-ons of the given type

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

get.description: List the on-call entries during a given time range.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: user_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only escalation policies on which any of the users is a target.

parameters.name: escalation_policy_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified escalation policy IDs.

parameters.name: schedule_ids[]
parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only on-calls for the specified schedule IDs. If `null` is provided in the array, it includes permanent on-calls due to direct user escalation targets.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

parameters.name: earliest
parameters.description: This will filter on-calls such that only the earliest on-call for each combination of escalation policy, escalation level, and user is returned. This is useful for determining when the "next" on-calls are for a given set of filters.

get.description: List all vendors.
Get details about one specific vendor.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Your API token.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The display name for the service.

parameters.name: checkType
parameters.description: The type of check: either http or tcp

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: How many seconds to wait until timing out. Max 30.

parameters.name: checkUrl
parameters.description: HTTP Check - The URL to issue the request to.

parameters.name: checkLocations
parameters.description: A JSON list of locations to check from e.g. ["lon", "dub"]. Each location has its own ???API ID??? which is noted on the locations list. Location ID's can be found on our support site

parameters.name: checkMethod
parameters.description: HTTP Check - The HTTP method used to issue the check: either GET, POST, PUT or DELETE. Required for HTTP check, irrelevant for TCP.

parameters.name: slowThreshold
parameters.description: HTTP Check - Request time millisecond threshold after which service is deemed slow.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The group the service belongs to. If this is empty it???s set to null.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: Basic HTTP auth username and password. e.g. {"username":"Thomas", "password":"password"}

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP Check - headers to include e.g. {"User-Agent": "Thomas the Tank Engine"}

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: HTTP Check - Content of the HTTP requestbody

parameters.name: validateCert
parameters.description: HTTP Check - Whether to validate the SSL certificate or not

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: TCP Check - The hostname or IP address to issue the TCP check to

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: TCP Check - The port number to issue the TCP check to

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: TCP Check - The content to send when opening the TCP socket

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A JSON list of tag IDs.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Your API token.
